intro: Odontites citardae, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock cress, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are narrow and elongated, often with a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are white or pale yellow. Odontites citardae is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
